bug.author: mishajw
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
streamlit.bar_chart(some_data_frame) will sort index values of some_data_frame before displaying. This prevents users from sorting by e.g. values. <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
streamlit.bar_chart(some_data_frame) with a DataFrame that isn't sorted by columns. <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
Streamlit to maintain sort order. <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
Streamlit sorts by column. <denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
No <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: Streamlit, version 0.47.4 Python version: Python 3.7.4 PyEnv

comments.comment: This is a good bug. Thanks for noticing, <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mishajw>@mishajw</denchmark-link> ! In the meantime, please note the workaround described in <denchmark-link:https://discuss.streamlit.io/t/sort-the-bar-chart-in-descending-order/1037/2?u=adrien_treuille>this forum post</denchmark-link> .

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mishajw>@mishajw</denchmark-link> ! Thanks for the bug report. We were talking about this and think this isn’t a bug, it’s just how line_chart/bar_chart/area_chart API works. We use the index as the X axis, which makes it easier to create charts in the majority of the cases, but sometimes it’s not what you want. For this case, we recommend using re-index data first. Also, we’ll improve the API documentation to better explain this. I’m going to close this bug, but if you think this isn’t accurate, please re-open and explain your reasoning. Thanks!
